page.title: 08THE SCHOOL BARBECUE
page.content: We all long for the end of term barbecue in the Summer. The money goes to{The Friends of Wingfield School}to buy equipment for the school. This year we raised Â£250 . About 130 adults and 75 children came. The barbecue had coloured lights, a jazz band and a marquee. Tickets cost Â£2 for adults and Â£1 for children. The parents had chicken and salad but we had hamburgers and salad and as much free squash as we wanted. The parents had beer and wine. Last year it was very hot but this year it was cold . It rained in the afternoon and some of the tent fell down. We all went out to help Mr. Pratt put it up again. It was skill digging in the sand pit and running down the ditch playing ghosts in the dark while the ladies and men danced. One dad helped by making a special Hungarian sauce.
